00071 class KernelDensity : public MixtureOfGaussians
00072 {
00073   public:
00075         /*
00076          *  If the given value for the variance is zero the global variance is
00077          *  marked as uninitialized and is estimated when data is assigned to
00078          *  the model.
00079          */
00080     KernelDensity( double va = 0 )
00081       : var( va )
00082     {
00083     }
00084 
00086         /*
00087          *  The centers of the kernels are set to the given data points
00088          *  (as in member function set). If a non-zero value for the variance
00089          *  is provided the global variance is set to this value, otherwise
00090          *  it is estimated on the basis of the given data points (as in
00091          *  member function setVar and estimateVariance).
00092          */
00093     KernelDensity
00094         (
00095                 const Array< double >& x,
00096                 double                 va   = 0
00097         )
00098       : MixtureOfGaussians( x.dim( 0 ), x.dim( 1 ) ), var( va )
00099     {
00100         a = 1. / size( );
00101                 m = x;
00102 
00103         if( var == 0 )
00104                 {
00105                         estimateVariance( );
00106                 }
00107 
00108                 v = var;
00109     }
00110 
00112         /*
00113          *  If a non-zero value for the variance is provided the global
00114          *  variance is set to this value, otherwise it is estimated on the
00115          *  basis of the given data points (stored in the centers of the kernels).
00116          *
00117          *  \sa estimateVariance
00118          */
00119     void setVar( double va )
00120     {
00121         if( va == 0 && size( ) > 0 )
00122                 {
00123                         estimateVariance( );
00124                 }
00125                 else
00126                 {
00127                         var = va;
00128                 }
00129 
00130         v = var;
00131     }
00132 
00134         double variance( ) const { return var; }
00135 
00137         /*
00138          *  In the first step the number and dimension of the centers of the
00139          *  kernels is adjusted according to the given data. Then, a mixture
00140          *  model (implemented in the base class) is initialized with
00141          *  equi-probable priors and Gaussian models centered at each data
00142          *  point. Finally, the global variance of all models is estimated if
00143          *  was not set before to a non-zero value.
00144          */
00145     void set( const Array< double >& x )
00146     {
00147         resize( x.dim( 0 ), x.dim( 1 ) );
00148 
00149         a = 1. / size( );
00150                 m = x;
00151 
00152         if( var == 0 )
00153                 {
00154                         estimateVariance( );
00155                 }
00156 
00157                 v = var;
00158     }
00159 
00161     Array< double > sample( );
00162 
00164     double p( const Array< double >& pat ) const;
00165 
00166   protected:
00168     void estimateVariance( );
00169 
00170   private:
00172     double var;
00173 };
00174 
00175 #endif /* !__KERNELDENSITY_H */
